column4: hey guys i've got a sound problem...please only help if you know what you are doing
can somebody knowledgable about sound please help me? I can't get sound going at all and nobody seems to be helping me...
im at my wits end here...makes me wanna go back to XP
I suggest sending a message onto ubuntu-users, if there are none who know more about sound issues here at the moment.
No, the mailing list ubuntu-users@lists.ubuntu.com
See http://lists.ubuntu.com about more info.
There your questions will be seen by all who know more deeply about it.
Sound issues might be very difficult to deal with, and maybe no one just are experienced about it, of whom are inside here now. :)
Can you give a link to the forum thread?
Thanks, I'll head towards that in a sec.
Found a site that says you have to enable CONFIG_SND_HDA_INTEL in the kernel.
Have you tried that? See http://www.lorenzobettini.it/linux/LinuxSonyVaioVGN-S5VP_B for more info. It seems to require recompiling the kernel...
Maybe nobody just knew about it, of those people who were present at the time.

You seem to be new here, so I'll just add that all who hang around here are mostly users of Ubuntu, there are no paid devs (or that many anyway) so it's basically just people like you and me who help each other. If I don't have experience on the issues you have to deal with, then there's no point getting furious about it. :)
No, it's not _that_ hard. Lemme find a wiki page for you.
sorry...im not angry
That's okay, just making sure you understand the nature of this chatroom. :)
i know and it does impress me that u guys are doing this for free...its just i've had this prob for days *cries*
There's a page like this: https://help.ubuntu.com/community/Kernel/Compile?highlight=%28kernel%29
If there's a driver for it, that's always better, don't, I repeat, don't compile a custom kernel before you try that out first.
Good luck, and ask questions before doing anything dramatic. :)
Sure. :)
